facts.text: This is an appeal by special leave against the decision of the Election Tribunal, Nowgong

anchor.surface_text: This is an appeal by special leave against the decision of the Election Tribunal, Nowgong, setting aside the election of the appellant to the Legislative Assembly, Vindhya Pradesh, from Laundi Constituency,

facts.text: Election Tribunal, Nowgong, set aside the election of the appellant to the Legislative Assembly, Vindhya Pradesh, from Laundi Constituency

anchor.surface_text: setting aside the election of the appellant to the Legislative Assembly, Vindhya Pradesh, from Laundi Constituency, on the ground firstly that he had employed Government servants as polling agents,

facts.text: Appellant employed Government servants as polling agents

anchor.surface_text: on the ground firstly that he had employed Government servants as polling agents, and thereby companymitted a major companyrupt practice under Section 123 8  of Act 43 of 1951,

facts.text: Appellant committed a major corrupt practice under Section 123(8) of Act 43 of 1951 by employing Government servants as polling agents

anchor.surface_text: and thereby companymitted a major companyrupt practice under Section 123 8  of Act 43 of 1951, and secondly, that there were at the material period, companytracts subsisting between the appellant and the Vindhya Pradesh Government

facts.text: There were contracts subsisting between the appellant and the Vindhya Pradesh Government for printing electoral rolls at the material period

anchor.surface_text: and secondly, that there were at the material period, companytracts subsisting between the appellant and the Vindhya Pradesh Government for printing electoral rolls, and that he was therefore, disqualified under Section 17 of Act 49 of 1951.

facts.text: Appellant was disqualified under Section 17 of Act 49 of 1951 due to subsisting contracts
